  • Ability to generate product-specific test strategy, plans, and executing testing accordingly.
  • Ability to communicate with contract manufacturers and colleagues in different parts of the world.
  • Ability to navigate and influence stakeholders at senior levels across teams.

About the job

Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

The Manufacturing Operations team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Structural Test Development Engineer, you will evaluate the product designs and create the manufacturing test processes, tools, and procedures behind Google’s search technology. You will also collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google’s infrastructure needs and product specifications.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct Design for Test (DFT) analysis and review to verify that in-circuit test accessibility and manufacturability meet DFT rules.
  • Develop and implement the Manufacturing Structural Test Strategy for new products, and work with CM/ODM partners to ensure that structural test solutions meet product requirements.
  • Lead and oversee the CM/ODM structural test development and deployment for Flying Probe, Boundary Scan, and In-Circuit Testing.
  • Review structural test fixture strain gauge and performance for fixture qualification, and analyze test plan stability and coverage to meet set expectations.
  • Provide technical knowledge and leadership in structural engineering throughout product life-cycles, including driving test capacity readiness, supporting NPI builds and analysis, troubleshooting, and root cause manufacturing yield issues and field escapes.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Our Global Clients and Agency Solutions (GCAS) team helps shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

As a Global Account Lead, you will define/refine strategy and Go-to-Market approaches for a global leading tech brand. The Global Account Lead will be responsible for growing a global brand, and building global account teams and managing them. In this role, you will be a collaborative thought partner to clients and speak for the entirety of the Google business, versus all products in the portfolio. You will also cultivate cross-functional collaboration, fostering partnerships across internal teams, ensuring alignment on account planning decisions, coordinated execution, and the delivery of comprehensive solutions to clients.Global marketing done right is becoming more challenging due to fast-changing consumer expectations, diversity in individual market landscapes, and the rate of technological change. At its core, Global Clients and Agency Solutions (GCAS) helps leading brands, trade bodies and marketing partners navigate this complexity so that they can continue to be the market makers who positively shape our industry. Everyday, we help our partners fully utilize Google’s products, talent and insights to advance their marketing performance and the advertising ecosystem at large. Whether through building stronger tech and media foundations, surfacing cutting edge insights or structuring industry dialogue, GCAS helps shape what’s next into now.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the development and execution of global account strategies, aligning with client goals and maximizing growth opportunities, and oversee the creation and implementation of joint business plans and innovative solutions to achieve key objectives.
  • Take charge of internal operational processes, ensuring the team efficiently achieves strategic goals, delivers insightful reporting, and consistently exceeds performance expectations.
  • Represent Google at the highest levels, building and nurturing C-level relationships with clients and internal stakeholders, showcasing thought leadership, and fostering trust-based partnerships.
  • Be proactive in identifying and removing roadblocks, ensuring seamless client service and successful outcomes.

title: Program Manager

About the job

A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

As a member of the Compliance, Safety, and Risk Management (CSRM) Team, you will be responsible for supporting Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) programs including management system implementation, environmental compliance programs and global oversight.

title: VP
post:

  • Experience leading teams and programs.
  • Experience driving cross-functional and cross-company programs.

Preferred qualifications:

About the job

As the VP of Strategy and Operations for the ML, Systems, and Cloud AI (MSCA) organization, you will enable the cross cutting and horizontal teams to deliver infrastructure to our customers. This includes leading product and business operations, Technical Program Management, the Chief of Staff office, and other horizontal teams. As VP, you will be a critical thought partner to the MSCA leadership team responsible for defining and delivering on the long-term horizontal roadmap and vision in close collaboration with key stakeholders. You will be responsible for leading the business cadence (planning and business reviews), analyzing key strategic business priorities and decisions, and driving operational excellence for the MSCA business areas. You will partner with Engineering and Product leadership and cross-functional teams and Partnerships to execute on complex projects and drive the growth of Google Cloud.

As part of the MSCA leadership team, you will use your leadership skills and program management and execution experience to mobilize cross-functional teams, predict and deliver solutions on time, and at scale. You will also help the organization make decisions using data and build solutions that accelerate our customers' success in the cloud. You will be responsible for building and managing the organization and your passion, technical and business depth, and excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills will empower our teams and rapidly establish trust amongst a diverse set of stakeholders and customers.

Setting vision and direction, improving productivity, quality standards, resolving systemic problems, identifying trends and implementing change are all keys to success.
The US base salary for this full-time position is $550,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities

  • Develop a consistent scaled strategic narrative across all MSCA teams, synthesizing major communication decisions between senior management and the broader organization, and ensuring strategy and priority alignment.

  • Manage/lead critical strategic initiatives across MSCA, developing compelling and insightful recommendations to the Google Cloud leadership team.
  • Lead MSCA-wide projects, both short-term deep reviews and complex cross-functional multi-disciplinary projects, from start to finish, structuring and executing analyses required to develop recommendations, and communicating findings to senior management.
  • Strategically partner closely with engineering leadership and GMs to ensure alignment with engineering and product priorities. Be responsible for cross-GM planning, execution, operations, and cross-data efforts.

title: Security Engineering Analyst
post:
Minimum qualifications:

About the job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Responsibilities

  • Perform complex data analyses to identify harmful entities, design and implement key performance metrics, examine trends, and identify system vulnerabilities.
  • Analyze potentially malicious websites and software to understand their behavior and impact on users.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering, Product, and Legal to improve system accuracy, fix product loopholes, and provide users with a better online experience.
  • Understand Google's product policy, enforcement, and risk strategy in order to identify key policy and enforcement operational successes, risks and inconsistencies, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Work with sensitive content or situations and may be exposed to graphic, controversial, and/or upsetting topics or content.

title: Environmental Health and Safety Operations Program Manager

About the job

A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

As part of the Compliance, Safety, and Risk Management (CSRM) Team, you will be supporting the Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Program for our Data Centers and Technical Infrastructure assets. Including EHS management system, environmental compliance programs, safety compliance, health conformance and regional/site oversight. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams within Google Data Center departments and contractors to identify and address EHS concerns, risk identification and mitigation. In this role you will ensure safety of the operations workforce, protection of the environment, and Google’s business. You will provide guidance with implementation of new and critical EHS initiatives and will contribute to the continuous improvement and iteration of our EHS programs.

title: Facility Operations Manager
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Associate's degree, trade school certification, or other verifiable training in a relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience working as a Facilities/Operations Manager or Chief Engineer within a critical facility.
  • Experience with electrical systems.
  • Experience managing/operating a mission critical facility including operations, technical, and team management.
  • Ability to work non-standard hours, including weekends and holidays on shift based schedules.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience planning and executing installation, commissioning, and equipment startup following industry best practices and protocols.
  • Knowledge of Electrical Distribution Systems (e.g., HV, LV, Protection and Controls, Power Quality).
  • Understanding of the operations and maintenance of electrical, control systems, and mechanical systems in a data center environment.

About the job

The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facility Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You'll provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.

You will develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

In a typical week, you'll assess technical matters, address performance issues, and support technical teams to minimize downtime while maintaining high EHS standards. You'll review operational budgets, expense forecasts, and performance metrics to ensure cost-effective strategies.

Other regular tasks include managing vendor performance and agreements, aligning goals with partners, and developing and delivering project management for internal and global initiatives. You'll work on emergency preparedness, operational excellence, and strategic planning.

At any time, you'll be ready to lead the response to critical events and ensure high facility availability. Additionally, you'll lead regulatory and customer audits, ensure compliance, and participate in community events to drive talent acquisition and retention.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Lead a team responsible to maintain, and operate sophisticated electrical distribution systems in a 24x7 critical facilities environment. Develop innovative approaches to reduce costs and improve efficiency. 
  • Plan and manage operational budgets and expense forecasting. Create and deploy strategies for cost-effective operations focused on total cost of ownership.
  • Meet service level agreements (SLAs) on uptime, efficiency, and cost.
  • Support strategy and plan deployments. Implement and drive a strong safety culture at the site.
  • Demonstrate critical thinking and innovation in addressing traditional and emergent data center challenges. Demonstrate flexibility to support our operations, taking the lead in responding to critical events when necessary.

  • Knowledge of online technology and related products, including web and mobile UI and tools.
  • Familiarity with user experience research principles and practices and how to use data to provide informed user insights.

About the job

As a User Experience writer, you are an advocate for Google design, working to shape product experiences by creating useful, meaningful text that helps users complete the task at hand. You help set the vision for content and drive cohesive product narratives across multiple platforms and touch points. As a stellar writer, you have a portfolio of work that demonstrates content that simplifies and beautifies the overall user experience.

You work with people in a variety of UX design-related jobs including researchers, product managers, engineers, marketing and customer operations. Collaborating with each, you strive to establish cohesive language and a unified voice across products and platforms. You regularly use empathy, logic and hard data to inform content choices, and are an expert in your product. You provide content recommendations that include the right words and sometimes complementary data and images.

You use your gift for language to design intuitive, delightful product experiences that help users accomplish their goals. You’re also a content strategist, defining product vision and narratives across multiple platforms and touch points. As a writer, you have a portfolio of work that demonstrates your gift for simplifying and improving user experiences. You will drive guidelines and best practices, manage complex, cross-functional projects, and work with leadership to set goals and implement roadmaps. You provide direction and mentorship to writers and support to peers.User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $134,000-$198,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities

  • Use writing and content design skills to create UI text that facilitates user navigation, as well on-boarding, promos, error messages, instructional materials, and other components of the end-to-end user experience.
  • Drive vision for product language and content across a product or subject-matter domain, and ensure cohesive product narratives; Document your strategies with guidelines, and establish best practices and strategy principles.
  • Manage projects from needs assessment to implementation; identify opportunities, establish priorities, secure resources, and manage stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with designers, researchers, legal, marketing, product managers, and engineers; Influence and adapt to stakeholders and their feedback.
  • Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship to junior UX writers and educate cross-functional partners on the role of UX writing and content strategy throughout the product development process.

title: Global Investigator
post:
info_outline
XNote: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Gurugram, Haryana, India; Bengaluru, Karnataka, India.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in investigations.
  • 4 years of experience conducting legally compliant security investigations regarding threats, risks, or other potential security issues in the Asia Pacific region.
  • 2 years of experience analyzing, interpreting, and drawing solutions from data, as it relates security investigations, and reporting issues.
  • Experience with investigative and interview training from a national or internationally recognized organization.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Certification in security including CISSP and CISM certifications.
  • Experience using threat assessment (e.g., WAVR21).
  • Knowledge of threat types and trends.
  • Excellent problem solving and decision making skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

About the job

As an Investigator on the Security Investigations and Assessments team, you will be responsible for protecting Google's assets, people, and information from insider threats by conducting comprehensive investigations and proactive threat assessments. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Security Operations, Security Engineering, Ethics and Compliance, People Operations (Human Resources) and others to ensure a safe and secure environment.

From keeping Googlers safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.

Responsibilities

  • Investigate a diverse range of security incidents, (e.g., physical policy violations, data leaks, and theft of IP), gather and analyze evidence, conduct interviews, and present legally complaint objective findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.
  • Assess potential threats, evaluate identified risks, and collaborate with teams to implement strategies to mitigate potential harm.
  • Assess existing processes to identify security vulnerabilities that could enable unethical behavior, and develop comprehensive recommendations to enhance security protocols.
  • Work collaboratively with various teams across Google to build a culture of security awareness and preparedness. Build relationships with stakeholders to ensure communication and coordination of security efforts.

title: Physical Design Innovus Expert Engineer
post:
info_outline
XNote: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Tel Aviv, Israel; Haifa, Israel.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in the semiconductor/EDA industry.
  • Experience in EDA tools and RTL2GDS flows.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering.

About the job

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

As a Physical Design Innovus Expert Engineer, you will collaborate with Functional Design, Design for Testing (DFT), Architecture, and Packaging Engineers. Additionally, you'll solve technical problems with innovative micro-architecture and practical logic circuits solutions, while evaluating design options with optimized performance, power, and area in mind.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Define and drive the implementation of physical design methodologies.
  • Take ownership of one or more physical design partitions or top level.
  • Drive to the closure of timing and power consumption of the design.
  • Contribute to design methodology, libraries, and code review.
  • Define the physical design related rule sets for the functional design engineers.

title: Quản lý đối tác trên toàn Google
category: Nhóm Giải pháp quan hệ đối tác của Google
post:
info_outline
XPlease visit this Google Careers posting for the English-translated version of this role.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bằng cử nhân hoặc kinh nghiệm thực tế tương đương.
  • 8 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực phát triển kinh doanh, quan hệ đối tác, tư vấn quản lý hoặc ngân hàng đầu tư trong các ngành Điện tử tiêu dùng, Ô tô, Sản xuất thiết bị gốc (OEM), Viễn thông, Thương mại điện tử/Bán lẻ, Ứng dụng, Quảng cáo, Trò chơi hoặc Công nghệ.
  • Kinh nghiệm làm việc với ban lãnh đạo cấp cao và các phòng ban liên ngành ở mọi cấp quản lý.
  • Kinh nghiệm quản lý các thoả thuận hoặc quan hệ đối tác.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Kinh nghiệm tạo sức ảnh hưởng đến các nhóm chức năng/cấp lãnh đạo khác nhau trong môi trường liên ngành và làm việc với ban lãnh đạo cấp cao của đối tác.
  • Kinh nghiệm hợp tác hiệu quả với nhân sự ở mọi cấp (ví dụ: lãnh đạo cấp cao, cấp quản lý, đồng nghiệp).
  • Khả năng làm việc độc lập và cởi mở trong một tổ chức theo cơ cấu ma trận phức tạp, nhằm thúc đẩy sự thống nhất và đảm bảo hoàn thành các nhiệm vụ chính.
  • Kỹ năng xuất sắc trong việc gây dựng mối quan hệ, cùng năng lực truyền cảm hứng, tạo dựng lòng tin và cải thiện kết quả công việc.
  • Kỹ năng hợp tác, tổ chức, quản lý dự án và giao tiếp xuất sắc.

About the job

Google luôn nỗ lực không ngừng trong việc phát triển các dòng sản phẩm và dịch vụ. Nhà quản lý đối tác chiến lược sở hữu cơ hội hiếm có để xây dựng một mối quan hệ lâu dài với các đối tác hàng đầu của chúng tôi. Bạn sẽ vun đắp cho các mối quan hệ đối tác hiện tại này để đảm bảo các đối tác đó có thể khai thác tối đa bộ sản phẩm/dịch vụ ngày càng phát triển của Google. Bạn sẽ vận dụng những kỹ năng xuất sắc nhất của mình trong việc xây dựng và phát triển mối quan hệ cùng năng lực nhận biết các cơ hội hợp tác đôi bên cùng có lợi với các đối tác nhằm thể hiện tốt nhất về người dùng, sản phẩm và chương trình của chúng tôi.

Khi đảm nhận vai trò này, bạn sẽ đề ra các kế hoạch chuyển đổi và dẫn dắt các phòng ban liên ngành đến với những cơ hội mới. Để đạt được mục tiêu này, bạn sẽ xúc tiến quá trình đạt được thoả thuận và thúc đẩy các sáng kiến chiến lược thông qua việc thống nhất chiến lược với đối tác, các kế hoạch hợp tác kinh doanh liên ngành, cùng các sáng kiến và chương trình quan trọng của ngành. Bạn sẽ làm việc với các bên liên quan trong hệ sinh thái của đối tác và Google để nắm bắt nhu cầu của khách hàng và tận dụng tối đa ưu điểm của Google để giải quyết các vấn đề mà đối tác gặp phải. Bạn cũng sẽ là người quản trị và định hướng cho các phòng ban liên ngành trong nội bộ.

Nhóm Quan hệ đối tác toàn cầu của Google kiến tạo nên những trải nghiệm người dùng vượt trội thông qua các mối quan hệ hợp tác giúp giải quyết nhu cầu của người dùng, thúc đẩy đối tác đạt được mục tiêu của họ và hoàn thành trọn vẹn sứ mệnh lâu dài của Google. Nhóm của chúng tôi chuyên cung cấp các giải pháp thích hợp, từ việc hỗ trợ các nhà xuất bản và nhà phát triển đạt được mức tăng trưởng kinh doanh mà họ mong muốn thông qua các giải pháp tạo dựng doanh nghiệp cho đến giúp các đối tác lâu dài của chúng tôi dự đoán và định hình quá trình thay đổi nhằm mang lại giá trị kinh tế và danh tiếng. Thông qua các mối quan hệ đối tác, chúng tôi xây dựng và phân phối nhiều dòng sản phẩm khác nhau, trong đó có Google Ads, Tìm kiếm và Trợ lý, Địa lý, các sản phẩm Nền tảng và Hệ sinh thái, Thiết bị và Dịch vụ, Sức khoẻ, Bán lẻ, Thanh toán, Hàng tỷ người dùng tiếp theo, cùng nhiều sản phẩm khác. Với phạm vi cộng tác trải rộng trên toàn Google, chúng tôi luôn đảm bảo việc phối hợp hoạt động nhịp nhàng trong quá trình làm việc cùng các đối tác mang tính chiến lược và phức tạp nhất.

Responsibilities

  • Thực hiện chiến lược lấy đối tác làm trọng tâm của Google nhằm thúc đẩy quan hệ đối tác tại thị trường Việt Nam.
  • Tăng cường đáng kể tầm ảnh hưởng của ban lãnh đạo cấp cao Google, mở đường cho việc tìm kiếm và triển khai các cơ hội kinh doanh mang tính đột phá.
  • Phát triển mối quan hệ với ban lãnh đạo của đối tác chủ chốt (bao gồm cả Giám đốc điều hành) đồng thời điều chỉnh chiến lược của Google để phù hợp với các mục tiêu chiến lược cấp thiết nhất của đối tác. Vận dụng tư duy lãnh đạo và thúc đẩy các sáng kiến cụ thể dành cho đối tác dựa trên chuyên môn trong ngành. Tạo điều kiện để các nhóm phát triển những giải pháp phù hợp với khách hàng.
  • Tạo điều kiện và điều phối để các nhóm Phát triển kinh doanh và Bán hàng làm việc với đối tác, tạo dựng sự minh bạch, tinh thần đoàn kết và vạch ra mục tiêu rõ ràng trong nội bộ. Trở thành đầu mối liên hệ nội bộ cho tất cả các nhóm của Google đang làm việc với đối tác.
  • Thúc đẩy các nỗ lực phát triển hệ sinh thái của Google tại khu vực Châu Á – Thái Bình Dương đồng thời kết nối với các bên liên quan chính (ví dụ: các hiệp hội) theo phương pháp tiếp cận có cấu trúc và mục tiêu rõ ràng thông qua các sự kiện, hội thảo và chiến dịch tiếp thị trong ngành.

title: Technical Sourcing Manager
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in analog mixed signal and physical layer IP.
  • Experience in working or managing IP vendors such as Synopsys, Cadence, Silicon Creations, Analog bits, etc.
  • Experience in architecting or designing physical layer Interface IP and analog mixed signal IP.


Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in cross-functional collaboration with domain experts from architecture, design, and power.
  • Knowledge of PCIe, USB, UFS, CSI DSI, LPDDR protocols.
  • Knowledge of PLL, SerDes, clock receivers, GPIO, sensors.
  • Excellent project management, verbal and written communication, and status reporting skills.

About the job

Be part of a diverse team that pushes boundaries, developing custom silicon solutions that power the future of Google's direct-to-consumer products. You'll contribute to the innovation behind products loved by millions worldwide. Your expertise will shape the next generation of hardware experiences, delivering unparalleled performance, efficiency, and integration.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. We aim to make people's lives better through technology.

Responsibilities

  • Map the IP ecosystem, plan and anticipate future Analog Mixed Signal (AMS) IP product requirements.
  • Work with Architecture, Product Management, Design and SoC IP integration and IP Quality Assurance (QA) leads.
  • Work closely with IP vendors to identify new features, negotiate schedules, influence vendor IP portfolios to maximize Google product differentiation.
  • Drive Statement of Work (SOW) and Engineering Change Order (ECO), change and version controls, and develop IP QA checklists and guidelines.
  • Ensure that the IPs are meeting our Design for Excellence (DFX), Domain Validation (DV), software, testing and characterization requirements by defining and specifying deliverable requirements for analog IP.

title: Research Scientist
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • PhD in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Coding experience in Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.
  • One or more scientific publication submission(s) for conferences, journals, or public repositories.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 2 years of coding experience in Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.
  • 1 year of experience owning and initiating research agendas.
  • Experience with modern LLMs and generative models.
  • Experience with multilingual LLMs.
  • Recent publication track in related GenAI fields.

About the job

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

Our team is committed to developing advanced methodologies tailored specifically for multilingual environments. We focus on pre-training multilingual models, enhancing the quality of multilingual instruction-tuning datasets, refining multilingual evaluation processes, boosting knowledge transfer across languages, and optimizing multilingual tokenization among other initiatives.

The Technology & Society organization connects research, people, and ideas across Google and Alphabet to help shape and advance our most ambitious technology innovations and initiatives and their impact on users and society for the better, and responsibly. In addition, we also aim to share perspectives, engage, and collaborate with others externally on technology related issues and opportunities for society.

Responsibilities

  • Author research papers to share and generate impact of research results across the team and in the research community. 
  • Research and develop technology for improving multilingual Large Language Models (LLM) such as instruction-tuning, pre-training, multilingual reasoning.
  • Research and develop technology for pre-training LLMs for target languages other than English.
  • Collaborate with other research teams to expand multilingual LLM technology.
  • Collaborate with Google first-party partner teams to deliver new multilingual technologies to production.

title: Senior Manager
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 14 years of experience working in technology policy issues within the state and local government.
  • Experience with government relations, policy analysis, stakeholder management and communications.
  • Ability to communicate in English and German fluently to support external engagement in this region.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working in technology policy issues within government, think tanks, public interest groups, or relevant industry associations.
  • Experience leading policy engagement with policymakers on issues relevant to YouTube’s business operations.
  • Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proven track record of executing cross-functional projects.

About the job

As a member of Google’s Government Affairs and Public Policy team, you'll be part of a diverse global government affairs team, working across regions, product areas, and functions. You’ll combine creativity and intellectual excellence with the organizational skills to manage various campaigns, projects and initiatives. In this role, you’ll advocate for Google to bring external perspectives back into the company to inform our perception and direction. You're passionate about the opportunity to shape the future of how we use and build technology for everyone.

Google takes its responsibilities seriously, including engaging with government and other stakeholders on important public policy challenges. The Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team leads the company’s engagement with executive branch officials, legislators, regulators and third-parties in the formation of public policy. Working closely with Google leaders, GAPP seeks to identify key policy issues, listen carefully to others’ views and opinions, and distill and share the company’s perspective on those issues with external stakeholders. While we focus on challenges affecting the internet, our issue areas are increasingly broad and encompass many areas where public policy, business, and technology intersect.

Responsibilities

  • Support YouTube’s Public Policy engagement in DACH and CEE by serving as an ambassador for YouTube’s interests to policymakers and key opinion-formers.
  • Be a point of contact for the Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team on YouTube strategy, campaigns, and engagement in the DACH/CEE political sphere.
  • Engage with YouTube leadership to develop public policy strategy, campaigns, and engagement within and across DACH/CEE.
  • Be a thought leader in how YouTube operates in the DACH and CEE political contexts who advises YouTube teams in how to get ahead of potential future policy issues.
  • Address policy and government relations problems, and develop and execute policy strategy in a way that benefits the users and business.

title: Data Analytics Customer Engineer
post:
info_outline
X

Google welcomes people with disabilities.


Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience with cloud native architecture in a customer-facing or support role.
  • 2 years of experience in a customer-facing role (e.g., pre-sales engineer, consultant, professional services).
  • Experience in data management Business Intelligence Application (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI), Data Processing (e.g., Informatica), or Analytics Platform (e.g., Hadoop/Spark, Netezza, Teradata).
  • Ability to communicate in Japanese fluently to support client relationship management in this region.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science, other technical fields or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with application development and integration, with software integration with Web API.
  • Experience supporting sales for enterprise as pre-sales engineer for a wide portfolio of data lifecycle.
  • Experience discussing the value of machine learning with customers.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

In this role, you will work with Sales teams as a data analytics solutions subject matter expert to differentiate and paint the vision of Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud with translating technical value to business value, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, engage in proof of concepts, and troubleshoot potential roadblocks related to analytics workloads and projects. You will craft the vision to transform customer business with the power of data, using Google Cloud’s unique technology (e.g., BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Data Catalog etc.).Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Build a trusted advisory relationship with our customers, identify customer priorities, discover the needs of data powered innovation, create the story to transform customer’s business using data, technical objections, and design strategies encompassing Google Cloud’s Data solutions to deliver business value and resolve blockers.
  • Support the team which helps enterprise customers for their digitalization with Google Cloud, supporting bid response, product and solution briefing, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of regional partners, focusing on translating technical value to business value.

title: Scaled Abuse Analyst
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in data analysis, including identifying trends, generating summary statistics, and drawing insights from quantitative and qualitative data.
  • 5 years of experience managing projects and defining project scope, goals, and deliverables.
  • Experience managing partnerships with Engineering, Product, and Operations teams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in data management, metrics analysis, experiment design and automation.
  • Experience with classification systems, ranking systems or similar.
  • Experience creating opportunities to innovate, conceptualize and complete while working with global teams.
  • Experience collecting, managing and synthesizing large data sets and information from disparate sources, statistical modeling, data mining and data analysis.
  • Experience translating investigative insights into business strategies and actions.

About the job

Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world.

As a Scaled Abuse Analyst, you are passionate about cutting-edge technologies and have experience with analyzing large scale data and scaled systems of review. You thrive in a fast, dynamic, demanding environment where no two days are ever the same. In this role, you will be a key contributor to the strategy for reducing network badness on YouTube. You are an independent, critical thinker with sound metrics judgment who has a passion for coaching others, solving technological challenges and setting scalable standards. You can balance the short term requirements we face while demonstrating the ability to see the big picture and make quantitatively based long-term recommendations accordingly.

This role may require on-call work at weekends on a rotational basis. This role may also be exposed to graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content during team escalations in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Responsibilities

  • Develop high quality training materials, create consensus and maintain communication for YouTube Scaled Abuse with business stakeholders.
  • Apply advanced statistical methods to large complex data sets to understand the impact of abuse to the YouTube ecosystem. Contribute strategy and development of new workflows against additional known vectors of abuse.
  • Learn complex and technical concepts and systems and deliver meaningful results using them. Communicate highly technical results and methods clearly.
  • Maintain, foster and promote quality by providing regular feedback metrics to the Global team. Manage technological solutions for streamlining quality assurance and produce scalable training solutions to emergent workflows.
  • Perform fraud and spam investigations using various data sources, identify product vulnerabilities and drive anti-abuse experiments to prevent abuse. Work with engineers and interact cross-functionally with stakeholders to improve workflows via process improvements, automation and anti-abuse system creation.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bằng cử nhân hoặc kinh nghiệm thực tế tương đương.
  • 4 năm kinh nghiệm về tiếp thị công nghệ, quản lý thương hiệu, tư vấn chiến lược hoặc trách nhiệm xã hội của doanh nghiệp/CSR.
  • Có kinh nghiệm quản lý các dự án đa chức năng hoặc nhiều nhóm.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Kinh nghiệm tạo và thực thi những chiến dịch tiếp thị tích hợp thiết thực và tác động lớn (ví dụ: ngoại tuyến, trực tuyến, tăng cường nhận diện, chiến dịch/hoạt động độc đáo và sáng tạo ngoài việc mua không gian quảng cáo truyền thống).
  • Kinh nghiệm triển khai hoạt động vận hành có sự góp mặt của những đội ngũ thực chiến quy mô lớn trên khắp đất nước.
  • Kinh nghiệm tổ chức và thúc đẩy chương trình, xác định phương hướng rõ ràng cho tất cả các bên và đảm bảo đội ngũ hoàn thành công việc đúng thời hạn và đạt được mục tiêu.
  • Khả năng chủ động với kinh nghiệm lãnh đạo, quản lý nhiều dự án phức tạp và tạo sự ảnh hưởng đến các bên liên quan cả trong nội bộ lẫn bên ngoài.
  • Khả năng chuyển đổi ý tưởng phức tạp thành nội dung đơn giản và trực quan, đồng thời cân bằng việc giải quyết vấn đề với thông tin chuyên sâu thiết thực.

About the job

Cho dù phụ trách một sản phẩm tiêu dùng (như Gmail, Tìm kiếm, Maps, Chrome, Android) hay một sản phẩm kinh doanh (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), bạn đều đóng góp vào một trải nghiệm tiếp thị hoàn chỉnh qua việc dẫn dắt mọi khía cạnh của hành trình sản phẩm. Từ việc định vị, đặt tên, phân tích cạnh tranh, ưu tiên tính năng cho đến giao tiếp với bên ngoài, bạn sẽ góp phần định hình cách thể hiện sản phẩm và giúp tăng trưởng số lượng người tiêu dùng. Điều này đồng nghĩa với việc bạn sẽ làm việc với một nhóm liên chức năng trong các lĩnh vực bán hàng, truyền thông doanh nghiệp, pháp chế, quản trị trang web, phát triển sản phẩm, kỹ thuật, cùng nhiều lĩnh vực khác. Khi đảm nhiệm vai trò này, bạn sẽ tham gia vào việc xây dựng chiến lược tiếp thị sản phẩm từ đầu đến cuối.

Là một Nhà quản lý tiếp thị sản phẩm cho các sáng kiến về Thương hiệu và Danh tiếng, bạn sẽ là người dẫn dắt các sáng kiến của Google nhằm thúc đẩy sự phát triển của nền kinh tế số, đảm bảo sự an toàn cho người dùng và giữ vững vị thế của thương hiệu Google trong hệ sinh thái kỹ thuật số tại Việt Nam cũng như đối với những người có tầm ảnh hưởng tại quốc gia này. Bạn cũng có trách nhiệm tìm hiểu hệ sinh thái kỹ thuật số ở Việt Nam và phối hợp với nhóm mình để xác định những sáng kiến phù hợp mang lại tác động tích cực tại đây. Bạn sẽ ra mắt các chương trình, xây dựng quan hệ đối tác và tạo chiến dịch tiếp thị để hiện thực hoá những ý tưởng này. Ở vai trò này, bạn sẽ tận dụng công nghệ để tạo tác ra động kinh tế cho xã hội nói chung.

Hiểu rõ người dùng. Hiểu rõ giải pháp. Kết nối lại với nhau. Về bản chất, hoạt động tiếp thị tại Google bắt đầu từ công nghệ và kết thúc ở người dùng, kết nối cả hai theo những cách độc đáo. Công việc của chúng tôi là minh chứng cách sản phẩm của Google có thể giải quyết những vấn đề trong cuộc sống: từ điều nhỏ bé thường nhật đến phức tạp và thách thức. Đồng thời, chúng tôi tiếp cận hoạt động tiếp thị theo cách mà chỉ Google mới làm được – thay đổi cuộc chơi, tái định hình phương tiện, ưu tiên người dùng, và rốt cuộc là để công nghệ tự chứng tỏ khả năng.

Responsibilities

  • Khám phá thông tin chuyên sâu về người dùng, người ảnh hưởng và hệ sinh thái kỹ thuật số để hỗ trợ việc lên các sáng kiến và chiến lược truyền thông.
  • Dẫn dắt việc ra mắt sản phẩm và chương trình mới: từ xây dựng khái niệm, chiến lược, kế hoạch thực thi sáng kiến, bản địa hoá nội dung, quan hệ đối tác, truyền thông, kế hoạch cho đến chiến dịch tích hợp dành cho thương hiệu.
  • Cô đọng sứ mệnh và các giá trị của Google trong một câu chuyện nhất quán về cam kết của Google đối với Việt Nam qua các sáng kiến được ra mắt.
  • Cộng tác chặt chẽ, phối hợp, hướng dẫn và tạo ảnh hưởng đến các bên liên quan liên chức năng để đảm bảo tầm ảnh hưởng tối đa của thương hiệu Google đối với những người ảnh hưởng. Quản lý đại lý và đối tác bên ngoài để xây dựng và thực thi các chương trình, đồng thời thực hiện hiệu quả mục tiêu của chiến dịch và mục tiêu kinh doanh.
  • Hỗ trợ giao tiếp ở cấp lãnh đạo trong bộ phận Tiếp thị và với các nhóm liên chức năng khác.

title: Lab Manager
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience working in an industry lab (e.g. semiconductor fabrication or hardware research facility).
  • Experience with safety regulations and protocols in a research environment.
  • Experience with maintenance of lab facilities with vacuum, electrical test systems, liquid nitrogen, and hazards/chemicals.
  • Experience with electrical, mechanical, and plumbing construction in a research and development setting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Vocational, engineering, or physics degree.
  • Experience with troubleshooting vacuum, pneumatic, mechanical, electrical and software systems down to a block/board level.
  • Experience in maintaining lab facilities infrastructure including PCW, CDA, N2, LN2 and HEPA filters.
  • Experience with CAD software (e.g. Onshape, Solidworks, AutoCad, ProEngineer), carpentry machining, welding, brazing, soldering and other joining methods; power tools and CNCs.
  • Experience with electro-mechanical measurements (oscilloscopes, generators, calipers, etc.).
  • Knowledge in safety guidance for developing chemical processes, equipment, and laboratory design.

About the job

In this role, you will need to have experience in maintaining lab infrastructure, coordination facilities operations, and assisting with equipment installation and facility planning in a research environment. This role requires an individual who can balance working and communicating with a wide range of stakeholders internal and external. You will interface with local municipalities, contractors, research scientists, engineers, safety and network teams.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $99,000-$145,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain lab infrastructure equipment to ensure stable operation.
  • Develop infrastructure maintenance procedures and manage service contracts in a high-tech environment.
  • Coordinate closely with technicians and engineers on equipment and facility related maintenance, shutdowns, and emergencies.
  • Assist with equipment installation coordination, facility planning and work with vendors to provide site ready infrastructure.
  • Maintain inventory and ordering/reordering consumable of high value parts and equipment.

title: Data Analyst
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience in data analytics, Trust & Safety, policy, cybersecurity, or related fields.
  • Experience in SQL, building dashboards, data collection and transformation, statistical modeling, visualization and dashboards, or a scripting or programming language (e.g., Python, Java, C++).
  • Experience in writing and maintaining ETLs (Extract, Transform, Load) that operate on a range of structured and unstructured sources.
  • Experience in leveraging data to derive insights and recommendations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Education in, or experience with, machine learning.
  • Experience in SQL, building dashboards, data collection/transformation, visualization/dashboards, or in a scripting/programming language (e.g., Python).
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal) and the ability to influence cross-functionally at various levels.
  • Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in an ever-changing environment.

About the job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

Within Trust and Safety, the Service Delivery team is responsible for the strategy, governance, and operations across the Temp, Vendor, and Contractor (TVC) population. Partnering with teams across Legal, Security, Extended Workforce Solutions (xWS), REWS, Trust and Safety (T&S), Engineering, and external Vendor partners to bring innovation and technology in building operations and protecting users. Service Delivery (SD) team members have the opportunity to create, develop, and implement some of the most complex operations.At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain Trust and Safety access and security systems, ensuring that security objectives are fully achieved without compromising operational efficiency.
  • Design and implement seamless integrations between business goals and security systems, including the development and execution of strategies that support the effectiveness of these systems.
  • Manage projects that involve multiple stakeholders, have stringent deadlines, hold significant implications for the organization, and require adaptability to changing circumstances.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the process area, encompassing domain expertise in data sources, access and authentication methods, and relevant products.

title: Engagement Abuse Analyst
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 1 year of experience in data management, metrics analysis, experiment design and automation.
  • Experience with classification systems, ranking systems, or similar.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience translating analytical insights into business strategies and actions.
  • Experience creating opportunities to innovate, conceptualize, and complete while working with global teams.
  • Experience collecting, managing, and synthesizing large data sets and information from disparate sources, statistical modeling, data mining and data analysis.

About the job

As an Engagement Abuse Analyst, you will be a key contributor to the strategy for reducing network badness on YouTube. You will balance the short-term requirements and see the big picture to make long-term recommendations accordingly. You will be exposed to graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content during team escalations in line with YouTube’s community guidelines. You will work on-call at weekends on a rotational basis as needed.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Responsibilities

  • Apply advanced statistical methods to large complex data sets to understand impact of abuse to the YouTube ecosystem. Contribute strategy and development of new workflows against additional known vectors of abuse.
  • Learn complex and technical concepts, systems, and deliver meaningful results using them. Communicate technical results and methods clearly.
  • Maintain, foster, and promote quality by providing regular feedback metrics to the Global team. Manage technological solutions for streamlining quality assurance and produce scalable training solutions to emergent workflows.
  • Perform fraud and spam investigations using various data sources, identify product vulnerabilities, and drive anti-abuse experiments to prevent abuse. Work with engineers and interact cross-functionally with stakeholders to improve workflows via process improvements, automation, and anti-abuse system creation.
  • Develop high quality training materials, create consensus, and maintain communication for YouTube Scaled Abuse with business stakeholders.

title: Content Specialist
post:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with reviewing or assessment of digital content.
  • Experience with data analysis and spreadsheet software.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with content policy, anti-abuse, and reviewing online content.
  • Experience identifying abuse trends or working in news or policy.
  • Experience with SQL and spreadsheets.

About the job

Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Responsibilities

  • Enforce YouTube’s content policies and ensure high quality policy enforcement, as part of the Hyderabad Content Specialist team within the Trust and Safety organization.
  • Manage escalations in the content policy space while ensuring high quality enforcement and clear written communication and policy analysis.
  • Review and manage escalations from graphic and controversial video content in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines.
  • Conduct reviews and source examples for critical policy drafts and partner with the Policy Enforcement Specialists so as to help draft enforcement guidelines.
  • Gather insights from the core reviews that translate into improvements across key operations workflows.

title: Content Partner Engineer
post:
info_outline
XNote: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Gurugram, Haryana, India; Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience coding with one or more programming languages (e.g., Java, C/C++, Python) and SQL.
  • Experience working with web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or HTTP).
  • Experience in technical troubleshooting, and managing internal/external partners or customers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience in technical consultant domain.
  • Experience with, and knowledge of, Internet video technologies (e.g., Digital Rights Management [DRM] solutions, video or audio codecs, live streaming, 360/VR, etc.).
  • Familiarity with the Indian internet and media ecosystems.
  • Excellent project management skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal business communication skills.

About the job

As a Content Partner Engineer, you will be a technologist working in a team that manages YouTube's largest partnerships, optimizing implementations, driving new business opportunities, and seeking innovative solutions aiming to build excellent, successful, long-term partnerships. YouTube's Technology Services is a global organization dedicated to developing and managing partnerships with the biggest Media Companies working closely with the YouTube product, engineering, strategy, and content teams to address our partners' most pressing and complex technology challenges.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to lead projects and cross-functional efforts (e.g., product, engineering, business development, operations, marketing, etc.) and should be a motivated individual looking to solidify YouTube’s strategic partnerships with the largest traditional partners and the most successful new media partners that have grown large businesses almost exclusively on YouTube. You'll manage technical engagements with some of the biggest media companies and be responsible for the ongoing success and satisfaction of a portfolio of partners. You will also be instrumental in improving existing operations, commercializing new solutions, bridging product gaps, automating partner operations, and taking new initiatives from conception to deployment.

YouTube/Video Global Solutions is the link between Google video products and sales. Our mission is to fuel innovation that keeps YouTube and Video free and accessible to the world. We do this by translating global market needs into meaningful product solutions that drive business results for content partners and customers.

Responsibilities

  • Identify, drive, and optimize the business flow from existing and new business opportunities by leveraging YouTube technologies with our strategic partners.
  • Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of our partner’s technical challenges.
  • Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams, including Product Management and Engineering.
  • Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance. Manage and support partners and stakeholders in India.

title: Practice Specialist
post:
info_outline
X

Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.


Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in machine learning algorithms, statistical analysis, data mining, and model evaluation.
  • Experience with large language models, multimodal models, and other generative AI techniques, including their architecture, training methodologies, and fine-tuning.
  • Experience in Python, PyTorch, and Jupyter/Colab notebooks.
  • Experience with open-source ML tools (e.g., Hugging Face, Weights and Biases, and other relevant libraries).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience training and fine-tuning large models (e.g., image, language, etc.) using accelerators (i.e., GPUs, TPUs).
  • Experience working with cloud-based ML platforms (e.g. Google Cloud Vertex Platform).
  • Experience with performance profiling tools (e.g., TensorFlow Profiler, PyTorch Profiler, TensorBoard).
  • Experience with ML performance benchmarks, distributed training, and optimizing performance versus cost trade-offs.
  • Proficiency in libraries and frameworks (e.g., Hugging Face Transformers, CUDA, PyTorch/XLA (TPUs)).

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

In this role, you will guide customers with platform architecture, migration strategy, and analyze cost and performance benchmarks to help them train and serve Machine Learning models at scale. You will work closely with cross-functional AI teams, Product and Engineering, Infrastructure, and Kubernetes specialists to remove roadblocks and shape the future solutions for customers.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Guide customers on integrating Google Cloud AI accelerators (i.e., GPUs, TPUs) into their overall cloud strategy, recommending migration paths, integration strategies, and architectures that optimize performance and cost.
  • Demonstrate the power and differentiation of Google Cloud's AI accelerators through proof-of-concept projects.
  • Work closely with customers to optimize their machine learning models for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency on Google Cloud infrastructure.
  • Create and deliver technical content (e.g., best practices, tutorials, code samples, presentations) to enable customers and internal teams to leverage Google Cloud AI infrastructure effectively.
  • Travel to customer locations and represent Google Cloud at conferences, meetups, and other industry events to share knowledge, network with peers, and stay current on the latest trends.

title: People Experience Excellence Global Process Owner Specialist
post:
info_outline
XNote: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India; Hyderabad, Telangana, India.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in program or project management, or managing cross-functional or cross-team projects.
  • 7 years of experience in people operations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in managing large-scale transformation projects.
  • Experience in benefits programs and relevant process and system design for program implementation.
  • Experience developing and maintaining reliable process documentation.

About the job

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities

  • Serve as a process designer for our hire to retire portfolio of activities and projects.
  • Design process and program improvements to address business needs and improve efficiency and customer satisfaction. Design and plan the roll-out of service changes.
  • Develop subject matter expertise on the global operations within a variety of service areas, to facilitate meaningful and effective partner discussions.
  • Work closely with regional delivery teams to develop and maintain resource documentation, including process mapping, training materials and knowledge management with a consideration for global needs.
  • Advise partners on risks, dependencies, timing, or technology considerations supporting a multi-year service roadmap.

title: Open Engineering Career Opportunities
post:

CapitalG is Alphabet's independent growth fund which invests in remarkable entrepreneurs and leading transformational companies. We are committed to helping our portfolio companies achieve their full potential, and we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are excited to help our portfolio companies build the future.

Whether you are just starting your career or are an experienced professional, if you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to explore the open Engineering positions at CapitalG portfolio companies.

About the job

Cho dù phụ trách một sản phẩm tiêu dùng (như Gmail, Tìm kiếm, Maps, Chrome, Android) hay một sản phẩm kinh doanh (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), bạn đều đóng góp vào một trải nghiệm tiếp thị hoàn chỉnh qua việc dẫn dắt mọi khía cạnh của hành trình sản phẩm. Từ việc định vị, đặt tên, phân tích cạnh tranh, ưu tiên tính năng cho đến giao tiếp với bên ngoài, bạn sẽ góp phần định hình cách thể hiện sản phẩm và giúp tăng trưởng số lượng người tiêu dùng. Điều này đồng nghĩa với việc bạn sẽ làm việc với một nhóm liên chức năng trong các lĩnh vực bán hàng, truyền thông doanh nghiệp, pháp chế, quản trị trang web, phát triển sản phẩm, kỹ thuật, cùng nhiều lĩnh vực khác. Khi đảm nhiệm vai trò này, bạn sẽ tham gia vào việc xây dựng chiến lược tiếp thị sản phẩm từ đầu đến cuối.

Với tư cách là Phó quản lý tiếp thị sản phẩm, bạn sẽ là một nhà lãnh đạo doanh nghiệp, định hình tương lai cho một trong những sản phẩm Google. Cho dù phụ trách một sản phẩm tiêu dùng (như Tìm kiếm, YouTube, Chrome, Android) hay một sản phẩm kinh doanh (Google Ads, Google Marketing Platform, Quảng cáo trên YouTube), bạn đều đóng góp vào một trải nghiệm tiếp thị hoàn chỉnh qua việc dẫn dắt mọi khía cạnh của hành trình sản phẩm. Từ việc định vị, đặt tên, phân tích cạnh tranh, ưu tiên tính năng cho đến giao tiếp với bên ngoài, bạn sẽ góp phần định hình sản phẩm và giúp tăng trưởng số lượng người tiêu dùng trung thành. Bạn sẽ làm việc với một nhóm liên chức năng trong các lĩnh vực bán hàng, truyền thông, pháp chế, phát triển sản phẩm, kỹ thuật, v.v. Bạn sẽ có thông tin đầu vào về quá trình phát triển sản phẩm, tổ chức ra mắt sản phẩm từ đầu đến cuối và lập chiến lược tiếp thị cho tương lai.

Hiểu rõ người dùng. Hiểu rõ giải pháp. Kết nối lại với nhau. Về bản chất, hoạt động tiếp thị tại Google bắt đầu từ công nghệ và kết thúc ở người dùng, kết nối cả hai theo những cách độc đáo. Công việc của chúng tôi là minh chứng cách sản phẩm của Google có thể giải quyết những vấn đề trong cuộc sống: từ điều nhỏ bé thường nhật đến phức tạp và thách thức. Đồng thời, chúng tôi tiếp cận hoạt động tiếp thị theo cách mà chỉ Google mới làm được – thay đổi cuộc chơi, tái định hình phương tiện, ưu tiên người dùng, và rốt cuộc là để công nghệ tự chứng tỏ khả năng.

Responsibilities

  • Xác định và thực thi chiến lược đưa ra thị trường cũng như phối hợp trong tổ chức để ra mắt tính năng mới, kể cả việc định vị, đặt tên, giao tiếp với bên ngoài, phân tích cạnh tranh và ưu tiên tính năng.
  • Quản lý và làm việc với các nhóm liên chức năng nội bộ và các công ty tiếp thị bên ngoài.
  • Tham gia thúc đẩy doanh số bán hàng và chịu trách nhiệm tối đa hoá tiềm năng thu nhập cho các sản phẩm của chúng tôi.
  • Làm việc với một trong các nhóm sản phẩm quảng cáo của chúng tôi và lập kế hoạch tổng hợp các tính năng của sản phẩm thành một giải pháp hoàn chỉnh cho nhà quảng cáo, nhà xuất bản và người dùng.
  • Xây dựng thông điệp, tài liệu hỗ trợ tiếp thị, sự kiện và chiến lược kinh doanh nhằm thu hút nhà quảng cáo và nhà xuất bản, tăng mức độ tương tác của chúng tôi với họ.

title: Labor Relations Manager (English
locations: São Paulo, State of São Paulo, Brazil
post:
info_outline

Minimum qualifications:
